title: EuroSCORE II Clinical Risk Assessment
description: European System for Cardiac Operative Risk Evaluation II - official clinical risk scoring system for cardiac surgery patients. Based on Nashef et al. (2012) European Journal of Cardio-Thoracic Surgery 41:734-745.

age.title: Patient Age
age.description: Age of patient in years at time of surgery

on_dialysis.title: On Dialysis
on_dialysis.description: Patient currently receiving dialysis treatment for renal failure

creatinine_clearance.title: Creatinine Clearance
creatinine_clearance.description: Creatinine clearance in ml/min. Used to assess renal function. Categories: >85 (normal), 50-85 (moderate impairment), <50 (severe impairment)

extracardiac_arteriopathy.title: Extracardiac Arteriopathy
extracardiac_arteriopathy.description: Presence of extracardiac arteriopathy including claudication, carotid occlusion or >50% stenosis, previous or planned intervention on abdominal aorta, limb arteries or carotids

poor_mobility.title: Poor Mobility
poor_mobility.description: Severely impaired mobility due to musculoskeletal or neurological dysfunction

previous_cardiac_surgery.title: Previous Cardiac Surgery
previous_cardiac_surgery.description: Patient has had previous cardiac surgery requiring opening of the pericardium

chronic_lung_disease.title: Chronic Lung Disease
chronic_lung_disease.description: Long-term use of bronchodilators or steroids for lung disease

active_endocarditis.title: Active Endocarditis
active_endocarditis.description: Patient still under antibiotic treatment for endocarditis at time of surgery

critical_preop_state.title: Critical Preoperative State
critical_preop_state.description: Any one or more of: ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation or aborted sudden death, preoperative cardiac massage, preoperative ventilation, preoperative inotropes or IABP, preoperative acute renal failure

nyha_class.title: NYHA Functional Class
nyha_class.description: New York Heart Association functional classification for heart failure symptoms. Class I (asymptomatic), II (slight limitation), III (marked limitation), IV (symptoms at rest)

ccs_class.title: CCS Angina Class
ccs_class.description: Canadian Cardiovascular Society angina classification. Only Class IV (inability to perform any activity without angina) is scored in EuroSCORE II

recent_mi.title: Recent Myocardial Infarction
recent_mi.description: Myocardial infarction within 90 days prior to surgery

pa_systolic_pressure.title: Pulmonary Artery Systolic Pressure
pa_systolic_pressure.description: Pulmonary artery systolic pressure in mmHg. Categories: ≤30 (normal), 31-55 (moderate pulmonary hypertension), >55 (severe pulmonary hypertension)

urgency.title: Surgical Urgency
urgency.description: Urgency of the operation. Elective (planned admission), Urgent (not elective but not emergency), Emergency (immediate surgery required), Salvage (CPR en route to OR)

weight_of_intervention.title: Weight of Intervention
weight_of_intervention.description: Complexity of the surgical procedure. Isolated CABG (CABG only), Single non-CABG (single valve or other), Two procedures (CABG + one other), Three procedures (CABG + two others or three non-CABG)

surgery_on_thoracic_aorta.title: Surgery on Thoracic Aorta
surgery_on_thoracic_aorta.description: Surgery involves ascending, arch, or descending aorta

metadata.citation: Nashef SAM, Roques F, Sharples LD, et al. EuroSCORE II. Eur J Cardiothorac Surg. 2012;41(4):734-745.
